A **potion of polymorph** is a type of [potion](/wiki/Potion "Potion") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

  - [2.1 Quaffing, throwing and wielding](#Quaffing.2C_throwing_and_wielding)
  - [2.2 Dipping](#Dipping)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

  - [3.1 Identification](#Identification)
  - [3.2 Smoky potions](#Smoky_potions)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [5.3 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated monsters with a [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") of 5 or less have a 1⁄30 chance of receiving a potion of polymorph as a [miscellaneous item](/wiki/Miscellaneous_item "Miscellaneous item"), with a 5⁄6 chance of one appearing in a monster's [starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") if a polymorph item is chosen.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

[Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may be given a potion of polymorph as one of the three random potions in their starting inventory, though they will never start with the potion and a [ring of polymorph control](/wiki/Ring_of_polymorph_control "Ring of polymorph control") simultaneously.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Description

The potion has various effects depending on its use, and can [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") items, [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster") or the player. Potions of polymorph cannot be polymorphed themselves.

### Quaffing, throwing and wielding

- *Main article: [Polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph")*

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") this potion will cause the character to polymorph unless they have [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging"), and will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the potion in either case. Monsters can also quaff this potion if they are weak enough - mercifully, this will not generate out-of-depth monsters.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) [Throwing](/wiki/Throw "Throw") this potion at a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") will cause it to polymorph, as will [wielding](/wiki/Wield "Wield") the potion and smashing it on them. Inhaling the [vapors](/wiki/Vapors "Vapors") from a potion of polymorph abuses [constitution](/wiki/Constitution "Constitution").

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Quaffing a blessed potion of polymorph will give the character a [controlled](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control") polymorph.

### Dipping

- *Main article: [polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling")*

[Dipping](/wiki/Dip "Dip") an [item](/wiki/Item "Item") into this potion may polymorph the item - this cannot polymorph [invocation items](/wiki/Invocation_items "Invocation items"), the [Amulet of Yendor](/wiki/Amulet_of_Yendor "Amulet of Yendor"), a [spellbook of polymorph](/wiki/Spellbook_of_polymorph "Spellbook of polymorph"), [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph"), or another potion(s) of polymorph. [Artifacts](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") have a 19⁄20 chance of resisting, while other items have a 1⁄20 chance of resisting.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) The usual checks for golem creation, items vanishing, artifacts resisting, etc. are skipped, but large stacks will still merge to small ones.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) Dipping this potion into another, non-[water](/wiki/Potion_of_water "Potion of water") potion will similarly polymorph the other potion, rather than resulting in random [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy").

Items that resist polymorphing will not use up the potion or break [polypileless](/wiki/Polypileless "Polypileless") conduct - however, an item may accidentally polymorph into itself, which uses up the potion and breaks polypileless. In both cases, the potion of polymorph is not auto-identified.

## Strategy

Wielding the potion and hitting a monster is not advised because if by chance that monster becomes a [footrice](/wiki/Footrice "Footrice"), you will be [petrified](/wiki/Petrified "Petrified").

### Identification

Most players can easily identify the potion by dipping an item into it, especially as quaffing may destroy some of your armor. Some conduct players prefer [price identification](/wiki/Price_identification "Price identification") or other means of identifying 200zm potions to avoid breaking polyselfless or polypileless conducts. Here are a few other methods that do not require magical identification:

- Dipping a resistant item, such as a wand of polymorph or the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening"), is always safe and doesn’t use up the tested potions.
  - A non-resistant item that polymorphs into itself will use up the potion, but also confirms its identity to [name](/wiki/Name "Name") later, since the message for this is different from the one given when nothing actually happens after dipping an item in a potion.[\[8\]](#cite_note-8)

* Quaffing while wearing an [amulet of unchanging](/wiki/Amulet_of_unchanging "Amulet of unchanging") uses up the potion, but prevents it from taking effect; fortunately, all the other 200 zm potions are safe to drink as well (although you may want to bless them first).

- Quaffing with a source of [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control") will pull up a prompt; you can then choose to [polymorph into your own race](/wiki/Polymorph#Polymorphing_into_your_own_race "Polymorph"), which doesn't break the conduct, but may have other undesired effects.

* Monsters with a difficulty of 5 or less are occasionally generated with one as their miscellaneous item, and watching one drink the potion will identify it. You could also try leaving 200 zm potions in the path of intelligent monsters.

- If you are not observing polypileless conduct, then [dip-testing](/wiki/Potion#Unicorn_horn_dipping "Potion") with a [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn") is a suitable method, provided you are not using your only unicorn horn - this will usually yield another [magical tool](/wiki/Magical_tool "Magical tool") unless the horn was regrown from a [revived](/wiki/Revive "Revive") unicorn.

### Smoky potions

A potion of polymorph with the [randomized appearance](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") of a [smoky potion](/wiki/Smoky_potion "Smoky potion") can be quite the inconvenience to any wish-hunters, as it will require unchanging to quaff safely - polymorph control can also prevent the polymorph from breaking or dropping armor, though it can still end up lowering your level or shuffling your attributes.

## History

The potion of polymorph first appears in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), and makes its vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, the Chamber of Junk in the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest") has two separate 2⁄5 chances to contain a cursed potion of polymorph.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), monsters may throw a potion of polymorph rather than quaff it, polymorphing any monster that it hits (including you) unless they have [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") or [unchanging](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging"); if a monster's attempt to polymorph you has no effect, they will refrain from attempting to polymorph you further.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, the [Undertaker quest](/index.php?title=Undertaker_quest\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Undertaker quest (page does not exist)") has two separate 2⁄5 chances to contain a cursed potion of polymorph on the goal level, which is a copy of the Lawful Quest.

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), in addition to SLASH'EM details, [doppelgangers](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of items that can polymorph monsters, including the potion of polymorph.

Monsters may throw potions of polymorph rather than quaff them, with the same behavior as in EvilHack. Monsters cannot be created with a potion of polymorph and a ring of polymorph control simultaneously, which is mostly relevant for generating [wizard](/wiki/Wizard_\(player_monster\) "Wizard (player monster)") [player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster").
